name: Wanderlust

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has some of the best service I've seen. My boyfriend and I stayed on two separate occasions, storing our luggage for a total of 3 weeks and our bags were already in the rooms each time we checked in. We stayed in the spaceship whimsical room as well as one of the pantone rooms. The Pantone room is definitely capsule style, quite cramped. The whimsical room is more spacious with the bathtub a nice touch. Also, there is a restaurant in the alley by the hotel that is open until 4 am which I think could be a noise problem on weekends if you're on that side of the building. Overall, highly recommended if you're in for a unique hotel experience with great service.
reviews.title: Incredible service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in at 2am...Service with a smile. Felt very welcome. Thanks. Loved the funny scrap book with the area info. Hotel is in the heart of Little India. Many veg' restaurants, great Indian atmosphere especially on Sunday. 7 mins walk to MRT Little India. The hotel is near Sim Lim electronics. Rooms are spacious enough, all necessary bathroom amenities. '(N)Espresso' Machine in the room is wonderful. Free minibar (non-alcohol) was a nice surprise. Would like some more lights in toilet and near the mirror...as you have to keep the curtains closed if you want some privacy...
reviews.title: Inspiring hotel, cute design!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: And a 'writing pad' to put on the tiled table(t) as this hotel is very inspiring for the traveler! and a 'luggage table or rack' would be nice. Loved the overal design. Would definitely recommend the hotel to women travelers (very serviceable staff) and even gay people will love this hotel as it is different and has some great design items.
reviews.title: quirkiness itself

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i absolutely adored wanderlust
reviews.title: cramped rooms, limited breakfast options

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: the information on the agoda website was misleading (nothing surprising there)
reviews.title: Cramped Patone Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Lovely quirky room. However, if u are unlucky, the noise from the back alley will disturb your sleep. Otherwise, i love the hotel!
reviews.title: What a pleasant surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a great find! an amazing hotel offering great value and service in a convenient location. I loved the free breakfast, free Wifi, complimentary drinks in the minibar and the free local calls. The staff was always very nice and friendly and the rooms are all unique!! We got the typewriter room :-) a gorgeous loft style room and I have to say the bathroom setup is very nice! The Kiehls amenities were the icing on the cake....!
reviews.title: Good Value and very cute design!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Breakfast offering was for a full breakfast, choice of hot items made to order; the buffet included fruit, cereal and breads; all good quality!
reviews.title: Unique hotel at a decent price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved being near Little India and going to Tekka market! TIP, try the biryani !!! there is a vendor who has to HUGE pots one with biryani and one with chicken, TRY IT!......! Found a HUGE supermarket called Mustafa's who had everything possible under one roof.
reviews.title: best hotel ive been to

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Singapore is an expensive city for hotels. Wanderlust offered a special deal on their own website (not evident on booking engines) which was good value at US$130 per night with breakfast.
reviews.title: Cute Cute Cute

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: This is a perfect choice for people looking for Singapore away from the bland streets and faceless, chain hotels. Situated in Little India, which has traditionally been a favourite for backpackers. Wanderlust has bought cool, boutique hotel to this colourful district. Service is friendly, helpful and genuine. My room was simple, but well laid out and full of cool things, such as Nespresso Machine, iPod Docking Station, Kiehl Bathroom Amenities, Free Minibar items and WiFi. There is mood lighting to set the tone and although the bathroom is quite open plan, it affords plenty of privacy. Breakfast was simple, but fresh and tasty. I liked the "do it yourself" muesli. Singapore is bland enough. Brighten up our stay in the city here.
reviews.title: Singapore with personality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My wife and me meet some friends in Singapore at the restaurant Cocotte on first floor of the hotel. I can not comment on the hotel itself, but the restaurant is very good. The restaurant is alternative and fits perfectly into the concept of the hotel. And so do the dishes. They are simple but innovative and taste jammy. They also have a nice variety of good vines.
reviews.title: The restaurant Cocotte is excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We where there on a Wednesday night and is was full. So I recommend making a reservation.
reviews.title: Delightfully themed rooms, friendly service & a great restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: My fiancee and I had our pre-wedding photoshoot at Wanderlust and we also stayed in the Whimsical Loft (Typewriter-themed) for 1 night. We chose this boutique hotel because of its unique theme that stands out from other boutique hotels in Singapore.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had pre-arranged an early check-in with the Marcom Mgr for our photoshoot and she was extremely accommodating to our request. Upon arrival at the hotel, check-in was pretty swift and the reception staff were very friendly. The Marcom Mgr even came to our room to greet us to ensure that everything is attended to.
reviews.title: Unique, modern hotel with nice touches

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love Little India in Singapore. Give me fruit & veg stalls, Teh Tarik & roti for next to nothing over faceless shopping malls in Marina Bay any day! Little India tends to draw backpackers as it offers budget accommodation, but if you want the atmosphere as well as a funky hotel then Wanderlust is it.
reviews.title: I would wander back to wanderlust

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012
reviews.text: I was worried the rooms would be like a box after reading other reviews. I went ahead and booked the Pantone room anyway it was nowhere near as teeny tiny as I thought it would be. (rooms in 1929 are smaller). Yes the toilet and shower are in glass cubicles - frosted glass I might add, so not a room to share with someone you've just met! The bed was very comfortable, shower good, towels & toiletries nice. There is a small fridge with complimentary water & softdrinks which is replenished daily. The room also has a safe.
reviews.title: Prefer more facilities for the cost.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Earplugs are supplied as the first floor is close to a street cafe but we didn't bother with and slept well.
reviews.title: Fun and comfortable, friendly staff will make you feel like home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found the staff very friendly & helpful, they looked after our luggage while we did a 3 night side trip and it was no problem. We were impressed with the breakfast...a continental buffet plus a cooked to order choice. We could see the chef from our table and everything was prepared fresh.
reviews.title: Nice stay in Little India

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: I would stay in Wanderlust again. I can taste the Teh Tarik & roti now....
reviews.title: stunning

description: Wanderlust in Little India draws madcap, curious voyagers to the old ethnic enclave. Made for guests with a sense of adventure, we invite you to walk the unconventional path where a radical hotel experience awaits.Its history began in the 1920s as the Hong Wen School, where the building at No 2 Dickson Road still retains its old-world charm with an unchanged façade. Situated 10 minutes from the cosmopolitan stretches of Orchard Road and the Central Business District; Wanderlust also offers door step access to a bustling, colourful street life. The four storey boutique hotel has 29 rooms. Just as no 2 rooms are identical, the same can be said for each floor in the hotel. It features the groundbreaking works of award-winning Singapore design agencies. Each agency was given full creative freedom to design an entire level in the hotel, resulting in four, different ‘in-your-face’ themes – ‘Industrial Glam’, ‘Eccentricity’, ‘Is It Just Black and White?‘ and ’Creature Comforts.’
